  • Collapse

Included page: .FlexOvl.AdhocControlStatus.SetUp (edit)

import
com.alliander.osgp.acceptancetests

script
start scoped giv wen zen for slim adhocmanagement


Narrative

As a platform I want to asynchronously get the status of a device

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119

Successfull retrieval of status from a device

scenario get status values device status relayType preferredlinktype actuallinktype lighttype responsePreferredlinktype responseActuallinktype responseLighttype eventnotifications index on dimvalue ismessagesent result description
given a get status request for device @device
and the get status request refers to a device @device with status @status which is configured with relayType @relayType
and the get status request refers to an organisation that is authorised
and the get status oslp message from the device contains @preferredlinktype, @actuallinktype, @lighttype, @eventnotifications, @index, @on, and @dimvalue
when the get status request is received
then the get status request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a get status oslp message is sent to the device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl get status result message with result @result, description @description, @preferredlinktype, @actuallinktype, @lighttype, @eventnotifications, @index, @on, and @dimvalue should be sent to the ovl out queue


get status values
device status relayType preferredlinktype actuallinktype lighttype eventnotifications responsePreferredlinktype responseActuallinktype responseLighttype index on dimvalue ismessagesent result description
device-01 active LIGHT LINK_NOT_SET LINK_NOT_SET LT_NOT_SET 0 true true OK
scenario get status values device status relayType preferredlinktype actuallinktype lighttype responsePreferredlinktype responseActuallinktype responseLighttype eventnotifications index on dimvalue ismessagesent result description
given a get status request for device device-01
and the get status request refers to a device device-01 with status active which is configured with relayType LIGHT
and the get status request refers to an organisation that is authorised
and the get status oslp message from the device contains LINK_NOT_SET, LINK_NOT_SET, LT_NOT_SET, , 0, true, and
when the get status request is received
then the get status request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId device-01
and a get status oslp message is sent to the device should be true
and an ovl get status result message with result OK, description , LINK_NOT_SET, LINK_NOT_SET, LT_NOT_SET, , 0, true, and should be sent to the ovl out queue
device-01 active LIGHT CDMA GPRS DALI DIAG_EVENTS CDMA GPRS DALI 0 true true OK

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • relayType: the relay type (LIGHT, TARIFF, TARIFF_REVERSED)
  • preferredlinktype: the preferred link type (LINK_NOT_SET, CDMA, GPRS, ETHERNET)
  • actuallinktype: the actual link type (LINK_NOT_SET, CDMA, GPRS, ETHERNET)
  • lighttype: the light type (LT_NOT_SET, RELAY, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSE, DALI)
  • eventnotifications: comma separated list of event notifications (DIAG_EVENTS,HARDWARE_FAILURE,LIGHT_FAILURE,LIGHT_EVENTS,MONITOR_EVENTS,FIRMWARE_EVENTS,COMM_EVENTS,SECURITY_EVENTS)
  • responsePreferredlinktype: the preferred link type of the response (LINK_NOT_SET, CDMA, GPRS, ETHERNET)
  • responseActuallinktype: the actual link type of the response (LINK_NOT_SET, CDMA, GPRS, ETHERNET)
  • responseLighttype: the light type of the response (LT_NOT_SET, RELAY, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSE, DALI)
  • index: optional integer (0-6) indicating the index number of the attached light(s).
  • on: boolean (true/false)
  • dimvalue: optional integer (1-100)
  • ismessagesent: boolean (true/false)
  • result: OK (correlationId is returned)

Scenario: Get status of a device with multiple lights

scenario get multiple light values device status relayType ismessagesent numberoflights result description
given a get status request for device @device
and the get status request refers to a device @device with status @status which is configured with relayType @relayType
and the get status request refers to an organisation that is authorised
and the get status oslp message from the device contains @numberoflights light sources
when the get status request is received
then a get status oslp message is sent to the device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl get status result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

and the get status request refers to a device device-01 with status active which is configured with relayType NULL

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • status: active (not required here, but added for reusability of the given domainstep)
  • ismessagesent: boolean (true/false) indicating whether an oslp message should be sent to the device
  • numberoflights: the number of attached lights to a device (1-4 for PSLD, 1-6 for SSLD)

Parameters:

  • domainType: the PUBLIC_LIGHTING or TARIFF_SWITCHING domain type
  • correlationId: correlation Id returned from a get firmware request
  • deviceId: device identification
  • isFound: is message found in queue (true/false)
  • preferredlinktype - the preferred link type (LINK_NOT_SET, CDMA, GPRS, ETHERNET)
  • actuallinktype - the actual link type (LINK_NOT_SET, CDMA, GPRS, ETHERNET)
  • lighttype - the light type (LT_NOT_SET, RELAY, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSE, DALI)
  • eventnotifications - comma separated list of event notifications (DIAG_EVENTS,HARDWARE_FAILURE,LIGHT_FAILURE,LIGHT_EVENTS,MONITOR_EVENTS,FIRMWARE_EVENTS)
  • index: optional integer (0-6) indicating the index number of the attached lights
  • on: boolean (true/false)
  • dimvalue: optional integer (1-100)
  • result: OK
  • description: Error message

script
start scoped giv wen zen for slim adhocmanagement


Narrative

In order to override ad hoc set light commands As an OSGP I want to make sure OSGP clients can resume a schedule for a device

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119

Implemented Scenarios:

  • Resume schedule immediately
  • Resume schedule on first schedule entry
  • Resume schedule for unknown / unregistered device
  • Resume schedule with invalid index -1, 7
  • Resume schedule for device that does not have a schedule

Scenario: Resume schedule

scenario resume schedule values device status hasschedule index isimmediate ismessagesent result description
given a resume schedule request for device @device with index @index, and isimmediate @isimmediate
and the resume schedule request refers to a device @device with status @status, and hasschedule @hasschedule
and the resume schedule request refers to an organisation
when the resume schedule request is received
then the resume schedule request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a resume schedule oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl resume schedule message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Narrative

In order to ... As a platform I want to asynchronously handle set light requests

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119

Implemented Scenarios:

  • Set light on / off / dimmed
  • Set light on for unknown / unregistered device
  • Set light with invalid index -1, 7
  • Set light with invalid dimvalues -1, 0, 101
  • Set light off (on = false) with dimvalue 75
  • Set multiple lightvalues

NOTE: Scenario is not yet complete: For example, in case of an unknown device there will be no async response with correlationId...


Scenario: Receive A Set Light Request With A Single Light Value

scenario set light input values device status index on dimvalue ismessagesent result description
given a set light request for device @device with index @index, on @on, and dimvalue @dimvalue
and the set light request refers to a device @device with status @status
and the set light request refers to an organisation that is authorised
when the set light request is received
then the set light request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a set light oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl set light result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • status: active, unknown, unregistered, ???
  • transitiontype: type of transition: DAY-NIGHT or NIGHT-DAY
  • time: optional time forecast for the transition (hhmmss UTC)
  • ismessagesent: boolean (true/false) indicating whether an oslp message should be sent to the device
  • result: OK or exception


Scenario: Receive A Get Set transition Response Request

scenario get set transition response input values correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description
given a get set transition response request with correlationId @correlationid and deviceId @deviceid
and a set transition response message with correlationId @correlationid, deviceId @deviceid2, qresult @qresult and qdescription @qdescription is found in the queue @isfound
when the get set transition response request is received
then the get set transition response request should return a set transition response with result @result and description @description

get set transition response input values
correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description
cid-01 dvc-01 true dvc-01 OK OK
scenario get set transition response input values correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description
given a get set transition response request with correlationId cid-01 and deviceId dvc-01
and a set transition response message with correlationId cid-01, deviceId dvc-01, qresult OK and qdescription is found in the queue true
when the get set transition response request is received
then the get set transition response request should return a set transition response with result OK and description
cid-02 dvc-01 false NOT_FOUND
scenario get set transition response input values correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description
given a get set transition response request with correlationId cid-02 and deviceId dvc-01
and a set transition response message with correlationId cid-02, deviceId , qresult and qdescription is found in the queue false
when the get set transition response request is received
then the get set transition response request should return a set transition response with result NOT_FOUND and description
cid-03 dvc-01 true dvc-01 NOT_OK VALIDATION ERROR NOT_OK VALIDATION ERROR
scenario get set transition response input values correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description
given a get set transition response request with correlationId cid-03 and deviceId dvc-01
and a set transition response message with correlationId cid-03, deviceId dvc-01, qresult NOT_OK and qdescription VALIDATION ERROR is found in the queue true
when the get set transition response request is received
then the get set transition response request should return a set transition response with result NOT_OK and description VALIDATION ERROR

Parameters:

  • correlationId: correlation Id returned from a set transition request
  • content: message content
  • result: OK or exception

Narrative

As OSGP I want to authorize an organisation for specific devices


NB: SET SCHEDULE CURRENTLY FAILS BECAUSE OF A CHANGE IN OSLP PROTOCOL (Schedule type added to request for PBI685)


Scenario: Call a device function and verify whether this is allowed.

given a registered device @device
and an organisation @organisation which is member of device function group @group
when device function @function is called
then the device function is @allowed

script
start scoped giv wen zen for slim basicfunctions

Narrative

As OSGP I want to authorize an organisation for specific functions

Scenario: Call a platform function and verify whether this is allowed.

scenario function matrix function group allowed
given an organisation which is member of platform function group @group
when platform function @function is called
then the platform function is @allowed

function matrix
function group allowed
CREATE_ORGANISATION admin true

when platform function CREATE_ORGANISATION is called
then the platform function is true
CREATE_ORGANISATION user false

given an organisation which is member of platform function group user
when platform function CREATE_ORGANISATION is called
then the platform function is false

Narrative

In order to make installed devices communicate in a secure way, sequence numbers are present in the protocol.
This prevents replay-attacks.
The device will register once every 24 hours. The device generates a random sequence number and a random value 'randomDevice'.
The platform will receive the register request and will use the same sequence number and 'randomDevice' value and the platform will generate a random value 'randomPlatform' to create a response.
The device will receive the response and will issue a confirm device registration request, using an incremented sequence number, along with the 'randomDevice' and 'randomPlatform' values.

Note

The sequence number has a range of 0 to 65535 (2^16 - 1).
The two random values 'randomDevice' and 'randomPlatform' have the same range.
The sequence number window has a value of 6.

Scenario: Register device that already exists on the platform.

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and an existing device with initial sequence number
when the register device request is received
then the device should contain an expected - equal to init - sequence number
and the device should have both random values set

Scenario: Confirm device registration.

script
given a valid confirm device registration OSLP message
and an existing device with incremented sequence number
when the confirm device registration request is received
then the device should contain an expected - incremented - sequence number

start scoped giv wen zen for slim configurationmanagement

Narrative

As OSGP I want to get configuration data from a device

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119

Implemented Scenarios:

  • Get configuration data
  • Get configuration data for unknown / unregistered device

Scenario: Successfully get configuration data

scenario get configuration data values device status oslpresponse lighttype dclights dcmap rctype rcmap shortinterval preferredlinktype metertype longinterval intervaltype ismessagesent result description
given a get configuration data request for device @device
and the get configuration data request refers to a device @device with status @status which always returns @oslpresponse
and the get configuration data request refers to an organisation that is authorised
and the get configuration oslp message from the device contains @lighttype, @dclights, @dcmap, @rctype, @rcmap, @shortinterval, @preferredlinktype, @metertype, @longinterval and @intervaltype
when the get configuration data request is received
then the get configuration request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
then a get configuration data oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl get configuration result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • status: active, unknown, unregistered, ???
  • oslpresponse: oslp response from device: OK, REJECTED, FAILURE
  • lighttype: optional enum: RELAY, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSED, DALI
  • dclights: dali configuration number of lights (1-4)
  • dcmap: dali configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 4 entries
  • rctype: relay configuration relaytype: LIGHT, TARIFF
  • rcmap: relay configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 6 entries
  • shortinterval: monitoring history interval in minutes, available values are: 15 min, 30 min, 60 min (1 hour), 240 min (4 hours)
  • preferredlinktype: optional enum: GPRS, CDMA, ETHERNET. Instructs the device which type of communication is preferred.
  • metertype: type of meter used for collecting power usage data, enum: P1, PULSE, AUX
  • longinterval: monitoring history interval in days or months, depending on longintervaltype, for days: 1 to 30 days, for months: 1 to 12 months
  • longintervaltype: enum: DAYS, MONTHS
  • ismessagesent: boolean (true/false) indicating whether an oslp message should be sent to the device
  • result: the response status, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • description: exception message in case of negative result

Parameters:

  • correlationId: correlation Id returned from a set configuration request
  • deviceid: device identification
  • isfound: boolean (true/false) indicating if a message is found in the queue
  • deviceid2: device identification
  • qresult: the result of searching for a message in the queue, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • qdescription: in case the qresult is NOT_OK, qdescription will contain the exception that occured
  • lighttype: the light type configuration, enum: RELAY, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSE, DALI
  • dclights: number of light connected to a DALI configuration (1 to 4)
  • dcmap: dali configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 4 entries
  • rctype: relay configuration relaytype: LIGHT, TARIFF, TARIFF_REVERSED
  • rcmap: relay configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 6 entries
  • shortinterval: monitoring history interval in minutes, available values are: 15 min, 30 min, 60 min (1 hour), 240 min (4 hours)
  • preferredlinktype: optional enum: GPRS, CDMA, ETHERNET. Instructs the device which type of communication is preferred.
  • metertype: type of meter used for collecting power usage data, enum: P1, PULSE, AUX
  • longinterval: monitoring history interval in days or months, depending on longintervaltype, for days: 1 to 30 days, for months: 1 to 12 months
  • longintervaltype: enum: DAYS, MONTHS
  • result: the response status, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • description: exception message in case of negative result

start scoped giv wen zen for slim configurationmanagement

Narrative

As an OSGP I want to make sure OSGP clients can set the configuration data for a device. The exploratory tests are executed via SoapUI..

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119

Implemented Scenarios:

  • Set configuration data
  • Set configuration data for unknown / unregistered device


Scenario: Set configuration data

scenario set configuration data input values device status oslpresponse lighttype dclights dcmap rctype rcmap shortinterval preferredlinktype metertype longinterval intervaltype ismessagesent result description
given a set configuration data request for device @device with data @lighttype, @dclights, @dcmap, @rctype, @rcmap, @shortinterval, @preferredlinktype, @metertype, @longinterval and @intervaltype
and the set configuration data request refers to a device @device with status @status which always returns @oslpresponse
and the set configuration data request refers to an organisation that is authorised
when the set configuration data request is received
then the set configuration request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a set configuration oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl set configuration result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • status: active, unknown, unregistered, ???
  • oslpresponse: oslp response from device: OK, REJECTED, FAILURE
  • lighttype: optional enum: RELAIS, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSE, DALI
  • dclights: dali configuration number of lights (1-4)
  • dcmap: dali configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 4 entries
  • rctype: relais configuration relaistype: LIGHT, TARIFF, TARIFF_REVERSED
  • rcmap: relais configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 6 entries
  • shortinterval: monitoring history interval in minutes, available values are: 15 min, 30 min, 60 min (1 hour), 240 min (4 hours)
  • preferredlinktype: optional enum: GPRS, CDMA, ETHERNET. Instructs the device which type of communication is preferred.
  • metertype: type of meter used for collecting power usage data, enum: P1, PULSE, AUX
  • longinterval: monitoring history interval in days or months, depending on longintervaltype, for days: 1 to 30 days, for months: 1 to 12 months
  • intervaltype: enum: DAYS, MONTHS
  • ismessagesent: boolean (true/false) indicating whether an oslp message should be sent to the device
  • result: the response status, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • description: exception message in case of negative result





Implemented Scenarios:

  • Set configuration data
  • Set configuration data for unknown / unregistered device

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • status: active, unknown, unregistered, ???
  • oslpresponse: oslp response from device: OK, REJECTED, FAILURE
  • lighttype: optional enum: RELAIS, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT, ONE_TO_TEN_VOLT_REVERSE, DALI
  • dclights: dali configuration number of lights (1-4)
  • dcmap: dali configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 4 entries
  • rctype: relais configuration relaistype: LIGHT, TARIFF, TARIFF_REVERSED
  • rcmap: relais configuration indexaddressmap (index-address separated by ',', map entries by ';', for example 1,2;2,3;); max 6 entries
  • shortinterval: monitoring history interval in minutes, available values are: 15 min, 30 min, 60 min (1 hour), 240 min (4 hours)
  • preferredlinktype: optional enum: GPRS, CDMA, ETHERNET. Instructs the device which type of communication is preferred.
  • metertype: type of meter used for collecting power usage data, enum: P1, PULSE, AUX
  • longinterval: monitoring history interval in days or months, depending on longintervaltype, for days: 1 to 30 days, for months: 1 to 12 months
  • intervaltype: enum: DAYS, MONTHS
  • ismessagesent: boolean (true/false) indicating whether an oslp message should be sent to the device
  • result: the response status, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • description: exception message in case of negative result

when the get set configuration response request is received
then the get set configuration response request should return a set configuration response with result @result and description @description

Parameters:

  • correlationId: correlation Id returned from a set configuration request
  • deviceid: device identification
  • isfound:
  • deviceid2: device identification
  • qresult: the result of searching for a message in the queue, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • qdescription: in case the qresult is NOT_OK, qdescription will contain the exception that occured
  • result: the response status, enum: OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK
  • description: exception message in case of negative result

Narrative


In order to make installed devices available
As an OSP
I want to make sure a new device can be added

Scenario: Add new device


script
given a valid add device request
when the add device request is received
then the device should be created
and the owner authorization should be created
and the add device request should return an add device response

Scenario: Add new device with empty device identification


script
given an add device request with empty device identification
when the add device request is received
then the device should not be created
and the owner authorization should not be created
and the add device request should return a validation exception

Scenario: Add new device with only spaces as device identification


script
given an add device request with only spaces as device identification
when the add device request is received
then the device should not be created
and the owner authorization should not be created
and the add device request should return a validation exception


Scenario: Add new device with invalid device identification


script
given an add device request with invalid device identification
when the add device request is received
then the device should not be created
and the owner authorization should not be created
and the add device request should return a validation exception


Scenario: Add new device with already existing device identification


script
given an add device request with existing device identification
when the add device request is received
then the device should not be created
and the owner authorization should not be created
and the add device request should return an existing entity exception


Scenario: Add new device with empty owner organisation


script
given an add device request with empty owner organisation
when the add device request is received
then the device should not be created
and the owner authorization should not be created
and the add device request should return a validation exception

Scenario: Add new device with unknown owner organisation


script
given an add device request with unknown owner organisation
when the add device request is received
then the device should not be created
and the owner authorization should not be created
and the add device request should return an unknown entity exception

script
start scoped giv wen zen for slim deviceinstallation



Narrative

In order to make installed devices available and reachable As an OSP I want to make sure a device can register itself

Scenario: A device which is installed and performs first time registration.

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and a device that is installed but has not registered before
when the register device request is received
then the device should be updated with new deviceUID, IP address and device type
and the register device request should return a register device response
and the register response should contain the current UTC time
and the register response should contain GPS location from metadata
and the register response should contain timezone of platform

Scenario: A device which performs subsequent registration.

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and a device that is installed and has already registered on the platform
when the register device request is received
then the device should be updated with new deviceUID, IP address and device type
and the register device request should return a register device response
and the register response should contain the current UTC time
and the register response should contain GPS location from metadata
and the register response should contain timezone of platform

Scenario: Register device that already exists on the platform, without GPS metadata

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and a device that is installed and has already registered on the platform
and the device has no metadata for GPS
when the register device request is received
then the device should be updated with new deviceUID, IP address and device type
and the register device request should return a register device response
and the register response should contain the current UTC time
and the register response should NOT contain GPS location from metadata
and the register response should contain timezone of platform

Scenario: Register device that does not yet exist on the platform

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and a device that does not yet exist on the platform
when the register device request is received
then the device should not be created for security reasons
and the register device request should not return a response

Scenario: Register device with network address already in use by another device

script
given a valid register device OSLP message
and a device that is installed and has already registered on the platform
and another device exists using the same network address
when the register device request is received
then the device should be updated with new deviceUID, IP address and device type
and the network address for the other device should be cleared
and the register device request should return a register device response
and the register response should contain the current UTC time
and the register response should contain GPS location from metadata
and the register response should contain timezone of platform

start scoped giv wen zen for slim deviceinstallation



Narrative


In order to test the correct installation of a device
As a OSP I want to make sure the owner organisation can start a device test

Implemented Scenarios:

  • Successfully start device test
  • Unsuccessfully start device test


Scenario: Start device test


scenario start device test succes matrix device organisation status ismessagesent result description
given a start device test request for device @device
and the start device test request refers to a device @device with status @status
and the start device test request refers to an organisation @organisation
and the start device test oslp message from the device
when the start device test request is received
then the start device test request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a start device test oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl start device test message with result @result should be sent to the ovl out queue


start device test succes matrix
device organisation status ismessagesent result description
device-01 ORGANISATION-01 active true OK
scenario start device test succes matrix device organisation status ismessagesent result description
given a start device test request for device device-01
and the start device test request refers to a device device-01 with status active
and the start device test request refers to an organisation ORGANISATION-01
and the start device test oslp message from the device
when the start device test request is received
then the start device test request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId device-01
and a start device test oslp message is sent to device device-01 should be true
and an ovl start device test message with result OK should be sent to the ovl out queue

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • organisation: the organisation.
  • status: active, unknown, unregistered; should always be active for success scenario
  • correlationId: correlationId of the message
  • isgenerated: boolean (true/false) indicating whether a correlationID is generated
  • isqueued: boolean (true/false) indicating whether a message is added to the queue
  • result: OK (correlationID is returned) or exception

Narrative

As OSGP I want to receive event notifications of a device

NOTE

OSGP does not store event notification settings and does not know whether a device is allowed to send a particular notification. Therefore each supported event notification is stored when it is received from a registered device. The OSGP client is responsible for maintaining event notification settings.

Scenario: Successfully receive event notifications

given a registered device @device
and a OSLP event notification message with @eventtype and @description and @index

then the OSLP event notification message is stored on OSGP
and the OSGP sends an OSLP event notification message with status OK

Narrative


As OSGP I want to remove a device

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119


Implemented Scenarios:

  • Successfully remove device
  • Unsuccessfully remove device

Scenario: Remove a device

scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device @device
and the remove device request refers to a device @device with status @status, @numberofauthorisations authorisations and @numberofevents events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised @isauthorised
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device @device
and the device @device should be removed @removed
and @numberofauthorisations authorisations for device @device should be removed @removed
and @numberofevents events for device @device should be removed @removed
and the remove device response should return @result

remove device matrix
device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
device-01 active true 1 0 true OK
scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device device-01
and the remove device request refers to a device device-01 with status active, 1 authorisations and 0 events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised true
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device device-01
and the device device-01 should be removed true
and 1 authorisations for device device-01 should be removed true
and 0 events for device device-01 should be removed true
and the remove device response should return OK
device-01 unregistered true 1 0 true OK
scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device device-01
and the remove device request refers to a device device-01 with status unregistered, 1 authorisations and 0 events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised true
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device device-01
and the device device-01 should be removed true
and 1 authorisations for device device-01 should be removed true
and 0 events for device device-01 should be removed true
and the remove device response should return OK
device-01 active true 2 3 true OK
scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device device-01
and the remove device request refers to a device device-01 with status active, 2 authorisations and 3 events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised true
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device device-01
and the device device-01 should be removed true
and 2 authorisations for device device-01 should be removed true
and 3 events for device device-01 should be removed true
and the remove device response should return OK
device-01 unknown true 0 0 false UNKNOWNENTITYEXCEPTION
scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device device-01
and the remove device request refers to a device device-01 with status unknown, 0 authorisations and 0 events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised true
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device device-01
and the device device-01 should be removed false
and 0 authorisations for device device-01 should be removed false
and 0 events for device device-01 should be removed false
and the remove device response should return UNKNOWNENTITYEXCEPTION
device-01 active false 1 0 false NOTAUTHORIZEDEXCEPTION
scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device device-01
and the remove device request refers to a device device-01 with status active, 1 authorisations and 0 events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised false
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device device-01
and the device device-01 should be removed false
and 1 authorisations for device device-01 should be removed false
and 0 events for device device-01 should be removed false
and the remove device response should return NOTAUTHORIZEDEXCEPTION
device-01 active false 3 4 false NOTAUTHORIZEDEXCEPTION
scenario remove device matrix device status isauthorised numberofauthorisations numberofevents removed result
given a remove device request for device device-01
and the remove device request refers to a device device-01 with status active, 3 authorisations and 4 events
and the remove device request refers to an organisation that is authorised false
when the remove device request is received
then no oslp message should be sent to device device-01
and the device device-01 should be removed false
and 3 authorisations for device device-01 should be removed false
and 4 events for device device-01 should be removed false
and the remove device response should return NOTAUTHORIZEDEXCEPTION

Parameters

  • device: device identification
  • status: device status; should be active or unregistered for success scenario's
  • isauthorised: (boolean) indicator if organisation is authorised
  • numberofauthorisations: number of authorisations; should be at least 1 (OWNER) for existing devices
  • numberofevents: number of events
  • removed: (boolean) indicator if device and related records should be removed
  • result: response result, for success scenarios: OK, otherwise an exception

and the remove organisation request refers to an organisation that is authorised
when removing an organisation

and the remove organisation request should return result UNKNOWNENTITYEXCEPTION

Parameters:

  • isExisting : [boolean] indicating if the organisation exists

  • name : [string] the name of the organisation
  • platformFunctionGroup : [string mapped to enum] the platform function group of the organisation
  • result : [string] the result of the request, OK or exception

and the response should contain the event notification @timestamp, @device, @eventtype, @description and @index

The following scenario fails, because the OSLP event notification does not have a timestamp and the creationTime of the entity is used. creationTime is set during construction of the entity and cannot be manipulated from the outside. Suggested solution: incorporate a timestamp in the OSLP event notification message.

Scenario: Receive A Get Set event notifications Response Request

scenario get set event notifications response input values correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description

get set event notifications response input values
correlationid deviceid isfound deviceid2 qresult qdescription result description
cid-01 dvc-01 true dvc-01 OK OK

given a get set event notifications response request with correlationId cid-01 and deviceId dvc-01
and a set event notifications response message with correlationId cid-01, deviceId dvc-01, qresult OK and qdescription is found in the queue true
when the get set event notifications response request is received
then the get set event notifications response request should return a set event notifications response with result OK and description
cid-02 dvc-01 false NOT_FOUND

and a set event notifications response message with correlationId cid-02, deviceId , qresult and qdescription is found in the queue false
when the get set event notifications response request is received

cid-03 dvc-01 true dvc-01 NOT_OK VALIDATION ERROR NOT_OK VALIDATION ERROR

given a get set event notifications response request with correlationId cid-03 and deviceId dvc-01

when the get set event notifications response request is received
then the get set event notifications response request should return a set event notifications response with result NOT_OK and description VALIDATION ERROR

  • correlationId: correlation Id returned from a set event notifications request
  • content: message content
  • result: OK or exception

Narrative

As a platform I want to handle a get power usage history response in order to show power usage history of a device

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119

Implemented Scenarios:

  • Successfully get power usage history
  • Unsuccessfully get power usage history

Scenario: Successfully get power usage history

scenario get power usage history success matrix device status fromDate untilDate recordTime index meterType totalConsumedEnergy actualConsumedPower psldData actualCurrent1 actualCurrent2 actualCurrent3 actualPower1 actualPower2 actualPower3 averagePowerFactor1 averagePowerFactor2 averagePowerFactor3 relayData1Index relayData1LightingMinutes relayData2Index relayData2LightingMinutes ismessagesent result description

and the get power usage history request refers to a device @device with status @status
and the get power usage history request refers to an organisation that is authorised
and the get power usage history oslp message from the device contains @recordTime, @index, @meterType, @totalConsumedEnergy, @actualConsumedPower, @psldData, @actualCurrent1, @actualCurrent2, @actualCurrent3, @actualPower1, @actualPower2, @actualPower3, @averagePowerFactor1, @averagePowerFactor2, @averagePowerFactor3, @relayData1Index, @relayData1LightingMinutes, @relayData2Index and @relayData2LightingMinutes
when the get power usage history request is received

and a get power usage history oslp message is sent to the device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl get power usage history result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Narrative

As OSGP I want to get the firmware version info from a device

NOTE: Authorisation is tested in Basic OSGP Functions - PBI119


Implemented Scenarios:

  • Successfully get firmware version
  • Unsuccessfully get firmware version

Scenario: Successfully get firmware version

scenario get firmware version success matrix device status firmwareversion ismessagesent result description
given a get firmware version request for device @device
and the get firmware version request refers to a device @device with status @status
and the get firmware version request refers to an organisation that is authorised
and the get firmware version oslp message from the device contains @firmwareversion
when the get firmware version request is received
then the get firmware version request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a get firmware version oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl get firmware version message with result @result and firmwareversion @firmwareversion should be sent to the ovl out queue

when the get firmware version request is received
then a get firmware version oslp message is sent to device device-01 should be false

NOTE: Device Message Status not implemented in protocol??? Therefore the following tests cannot be performed...


  • |device-01|active |FAILURE |true |DEVICEMESSAGEFAILEDEXCEPTION |
  • |device-01|active |REJECTED |true |DEVICEMESSAGEREJECTEDEXCEPTION|

Parameters:

  • device: device identification
  • status: active, unknown, unregistered, ???
  • isgenerated: boolean (true/false) indicating whether a correlationID is generated
  • isqueued: boolean (true/false) indicating whether a message is added to the queue
  • result: OK (correlationID is returned) or exception

Narrative

Narrative

given a set schedule request for device @device with @weekday, @startday, @endday, @actiontime, @time, @triggerwindow, @lightvalue and @triggertype
and the set schedule request refers to device @device with status @status which always returns @oslpresponse
and the set schedule request refers to an authorised organisation
when the set schedule request is received
then the set schedule request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a set schedule oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl set schedule result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

and the set schedule request refers to device device-01 with status active which always returns OK
and the set schedule request refers to an authorised organisation
when the set schedule request is received
then the set schedule request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId device-01
and a set schedule oslp message is sent to device device-01 should be true
and an ovl set schedule result message with result OK and description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Parameters


* device: device identification
* status: device status (active, unknown, unregistered, ???)
* oslpresponse: oslp response from device (OK, REJECTED, FAILURE)
* weekday: day for schedule (MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY, WEEKDAY, WEEKEND, ABSOLUTEDAY)
* startday: start date for schedule in yyyymmdd format
* endday: end date for schedule in yyyymmdd format
* actiontime: action time for schedule: ABSOLUTETIME, SUNRISE, SUNSET
* time: time for schedule in hhmmss UTC
* triggerwindow: window for schedule in minutes before, minutes after
* lightvalue: lightvalues separated by ; containing index, on, dimvalue separated by ,
* triggertype: the trigger type
* totalpages: the total number of pages with schedules
* currentpage: the current page with schedules
* pagesize: the number of schedules on a page
* ismessagesent: is oslp message expected to be sent?
* result: expected result returned by osgp
* description: exception or error

scenario set schedule input parameters device status oslpresponse weekday startday endday actiontime time triggerwindow lightvalue triggertype ismessagesent result description
given a set schedule request for device device-01 with MONDAY, , , SUNSET, , , 0,true, and ASTRONOMICAL
and the set schedule request refers to device device-01 with status active which always returns OK
and the set schedule request refers to an authorised organisation
when the set schedule request is received
then the set schedule request should return a validation error
and a set schedule oslp message is sent to device device-01 should be false

Parameters


* device: device identification
* status: device status (active, unknown, unregistered, ???)
* oslpresponse: oslp response from device (OK, REJECTED, FAILURE)
* weekday: day for schedule (MONDAY, TUESDAY, WEDNESDAY, THURSDAY, FRIDAY, SATURDAY, SUNDAY, WEEKDAY, WEEKEND, ABSOLUTEDAY)
* startday: start date for schedule in yyyymmdd format
* endday: end date for schedule in yyyymmdd format
* actiontime: action time for schedule: ABSOLUTETIME, SUNRISE, SUNSET
* time: time for schedule in hhmmss UTC
* triggerwindow: window for schedule in minutes before, minutes after
* lightvalue: lightvalues separated by ; containing index, on, dimvalue separated by ,
* triggertype: the trigger type
* totalpages: the total number of pages with schedules
* currentpage: the current page with schedules
* pagesize: the number of schedules on a page
* ismessagesent: is oslp message expected to be sent?
* result: expected result returned by osgp
* description: exception or error

Narrative

As OSGP I want clients to be able to set a tariff schedule for a selection of devices

Scenario: Set schedule

scenario set schedule input parameters device status oslpresponse weekday startday endday time index relayType ishigh tariffvalue ismessagesent result description
given a set tariff schedule request for device @device with weekday @weekday, startday @startday, endday @endday, time @time, index @index, relayType @relayType and ishigh @ishigh
and the set tariff schedule request refers device @device with status @status which always returns @oslpresponse
and the set tariff schedule request refers to an authorised organisation
when the set tariff schedule request is received
then the set tariff schedule request should return an async response with a correlationId and deviceId @device
and a set tariff schedule oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent
and an ovl set tariff schedule result message with result @result and description @description should be sent to the ovl out queue

Parameters

  • startday: start date for schedule in yyyymmdd format
  • endday: end date for schedule in yyyymmdd format
  • time: time for schedule in hhmmss UTC
  • index: the index of the tariff relay
  • relayType: the configuration for the tariff relay (LIGHT, TARIFF, TARIFF_REVERSED)
  • ishigh: high or low tariff
  • ismessagesent: is oslp message expected to be sent?
  • result: expected result returned by osgp (OK, NOT OK)
  • description: exception or error

and the set tariff schedule request refers to an authorised organisation

and a set tariff schedule oslp message is sent to device @device should be @ismessagesent

Scenario: Receive A Get Set Tariff Schedule Response Request

Parameters:

  • correlationId: correlation Id returned from a set light request
  • deviceid: the device identification
  • isfound: response found in the queue (true/false)
  • deviceid2: the other device identification
  • qresult: the result of the searching for the response in the queue (OK, NOT_FOUND, NOT_OK)
  • result: OK, NOT_OK or NOT_FOUND
  • description: exception or error
